TEMPTING.Definition: seeming to be good and making you want to do it

INCENTIVES.Definition: something that encourages (persuades) you to do something

DISPOSABLE INCOME.Definition: money to spend on non-essential things

MISCONCEPTION.Definition: something that is believed but isn't correct

BARGAINS.Definition: something available for a lower price than normal

TRANSACTION.Definition: a time when you buy or sell something

PERSUADED.Definition: made to do or think something

HOUSEHOLD NAME.Definition: something that most people know about

SEEMINGLY.Definition: appearing to have a particular quality, but often doesn't have it

BARGAIN.Definition: something available for a lower price than normal

SUBCONSCIOUSLY.Definition: in a way that you do not know about

EQUIVALENT.Definition: having the same amount, the same

MAST.Definition: a tall pole on a ship

SIRENS'.Definition: the Sirens were a group of women in Ancient Greek stories who sang songs to trap sailors

ZOMBIES.Definition: dead creatures that have been brought back to life and move around without thinking

SELF-SUFFICIENT.Definition: able to provide everything you need

HOVER OVER.Definition: keep your mouse over for a short period

TAKE THE PLUNGE.Definition: to do something for the first time
